steps.title: Dial the exit code.
steps.content: Dial the exit code. This tells the phone company you are dialing outside of the US. This code is 011 . Indicate that the call is an international call by dialing 011. If the call is being made from a cellular phone, the + symbol can be used instead of the 011 international calling code.

steps.title: Dial the country code.
steps.content: Dial the country code. This is the code that informs the telephone company which country to route the call to. To call Germany, this code is 49 .

steps.title: Dial the main number with the area code.
steps.content: Dial the main number with the area code. Dial the phone number of the person you are trying to reach. Make sure the number you were given does not include the country code or the area code. Place the call carefully, making sure that all codes are dialed in the correct order.

steps.title: Wait for the ringtone.
steps.content: Wait for the ringtone. It may take longer than normal to connect.

steps.title: Find the number of the person you want to call.
steps.content: Find the number of the person you want to call. If you don't already know the number for where you need to call, you will need to find the number, either on a website, in a book, or from a family member or friend that you are trying to call.

steps.title: Make sure that the area code is included.
steps.content: Make sure that the area code is included. The area codes are 2-5 digits long. A phone number without the area code is 3-9 digits long. Generally, numbers you would need to call would be about 9 digits, so if it is only 9 digits long then you will need to figure out the area code. One thing you can do is look up the area code for the region you are calling and see if it matches up with the first few numbers that you have.

steps.title: Confirm the desired phone number.
steps.content: Confirm the desired phone number. International calling rates are usually quite steep, so a call to the wrong number would be a costly mistake. If the number can't be retrieved directly from the person or business being called, international phone directories, both residential and commercial, are available on the Internet.

steps.title: Install Skype.
steps.content: Install Skype. This program can be downloaded for free from the official website. It can even be installed as an app on phones!

steps.title: Get Skype credit.
steps.content: Get Skype credit. Buy credit from Skype or get a subscription. Calls to phones cost money, but are much cheaper than calling from a landline.

steps.title: Get a mic and headphones if you want them.
steps.content: Get a mic and headphones if you want them. If you are using a computer instead of a phone, you will need to make sure you have these things or you might not be able to hear your call and they won't be able to hear you!

steps.title: Find the phone number as described above.
steps.content: Find the phone number as described above. You will still need the number to call using Skype.

steps.title: Open the dialer and enter the number.
steps.content: Open the dialer and enter the number. Open the program and click the call phones button (usually on the left). Click the call button once you've entered the number. It will not call until you do this. Enjoy your call and hang up when you are done by pressing the hang-up button.
